purpleculture_pinyin:
píng
to lean against; to rely on; on the basis of; no matter (how, what etc); proof
прислониться; полагаться на; на основе; неважно (как, что и т. д.); доказательство

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 凭)
Pictophonetic: 馮 indicates the sound; 心 (heart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
憑借 [ píng jiè ]: to rely on; to depend on; by means of; thanks to; sth that one relies on
憑證 [ píng zhèng ]: proof; certificate; receipt; voucher
憑空 [ píng kōng ]: baseless (lie); without foundation

    • 心 [ xīn ] heart; mind; soul
heisig_chinese_memo: The horse and its heart were frozen and kept for proof in a murder case. &nbsp
Ru_Meaning: depend, rely, evidence, proof, according to, possess, haunt

Ru_trainchinese:

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the ice (冫) in the horse's (馬) heart (心) possesses it
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: After discovering the evidence which would save a man from going to jail I appoint my assistant to take the proof to the court, but he dropped the documents and the blow away in the wind.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " heart " and " feng " sound, the original meaning is to rely on. "Shu‧Gu Ming": "The appearance is served with a jade table."

" Ping " can mean relying on and relying on. "Selected Works-Lu Ji's Bitter Cold Travel": "The fierce tiger leans against Lin Xiao, and the mysterious ape sighs at the shore." Li Shan's note: "Ping, Yi Ye."

" Ping " also means attachment. Jin Ganbao's "Sou Shen Ji" Volume Four: "Suddenly heard that there is a god calling out: "My emissary of the emperor, if you want to follow the emperor, can you?""

" Ping " also expresses the basis. Tang Hanyu "Records of Emperor Jin Shunzong": "The reason why you know the ancients today, and the reason you know the present later, cannot be passed on orally. It must be based on history."

" Reliable " also refers to a certificate. Song Zhouhui's "Farewell to the Qing Dynasty" volume: "First, I went to the northern border, and asked for Zhao Liangsi to return to the country, and printed it to Ping by the deputy."

" Ping " also means to let it go. Tang Wangjian's Eleventh of "Original New Residence": "Ancient Jie relies on people to expand, and leisure poems can be chanted by guests."

" Ping " also refers to request and trouble. Tang Dufu "Public Security Sent Li's Twenty-Ninth Brother Jin Su to Shu's Remaining Mian'e": "With a hundred dollars of money, I wander and ask Junping."

Satisfaction is also expressed by " reliance ". "Chu Ci‧ Lisao": "Everyone is eager to be greedy, relying on not to seek." Wang Yi's note: "Ping, full. The name of Chu people is full of Ping."

" Ping " can also mean boredom and anger. Han Zhang Heng's "Xijing Fu": "Although Si Yuzhi is frank, his heart still depends on it, but he hasn't pressed it."

" Ping " can also mean grand and prosperous. "Liezi Tang Wen": "The emperor uses anger to invade and subdue the emperor of Long Bo's kingdom, and invade the people of Xiao Long Bo to make it short." Zhang Zhan's note: "Ping, Da Ye."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " heart " and " feng ", the original meaning is to rely on.
humanum_full_description:
從「心」，「馮」聲，本義為倚靠。《書‧顧命》：「相被冕服，憑玉几。」

　　「憑」可表示依托、依仗。《文選‧陸機〈苦寒行〉》：「猛虎憑林嘯，玄猿臨岸嘆。」李善注：「憑，依也。」

　　「憑」也表示依附。晉干寶《搜神記》卷四：「忽聞有神呼曰：『我天帝使者，欲下憑君，可乎？』」

　　「憑」還表示根據。唐韓愈〈進順宗皇帝實錄表狀〉：「今之所以知古，後之所以知今，不可口傳，必憑諸史。」

　　「憑」也指證書。宋周煇《清波別志》卷上：「先是，貫在北境，約趙良嗣歸國，以副使印給憑。」

　　「憑」亦表示任憑。唐王建〈原上新居〉之十一：「古碣憑人搨，閑詩任客吟。」

　　「憑」還指請求、煩勞。唐杜甫〈公安送李二十九弟晉肅入蜀余下沔鄂〉：「憑將百錢卜，漂泊問君平。」

　　滿足也用「憑」表示。《楚辭‧離騷》：「眾皆競進以貪婪兮，憑不猒乎求索。」王逸注：「憑，滿也。楚人名滿曰憑。」

　　「憑」也可表示煩悶、憤怒。漢張衡〈西京賦〉：「雖斯宇之既坦，心猶憑而未攄。」

　　「憑」還可表示大、盛。《列子‧湯問》：「帝憑怒，侵減龍伯之國使阨，侵小龍伯之民使短。」張湛注：「憑，大也。」
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
憑 (Simplified: 凭)
Pinyin: píng
English Definition: to lean against; to rely on; on the basis of; no matter (how, what etc); proof
Total strokes: 16; Radical: 心
Pictophonetic: 馮 indicates the sound; 心 (heart) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 馮 [ féng ] to gallop; by dint of; surname
    • 心 [ xīn ] heart; mind; soul
Example Words:
憑借 [ píng jiè ]: to rely on; to depend on; by means of; thanks to; sth that one relies on
憑證 [ píng zhèng ]: proof; certificate; receipt; voucher
憑空 [ píng kōng ]: baseless (lie); without foundation
More: 憑* | *憑 | *憑*

③根據：憑票入場。
④證據：憑據。文憑。憑空。憑證。空口無憑。

Chinese: The horse and its heart were frozen and kept for proof in a murder case.  
Meaning: proof
Hanzi: 凭
Story: After discovering the evidence which would save a man from going to jail I appoint my assistant to take the proof to the court, but he dropped the documents and the blow away in the wind.
Kind: traditional
從「 心 」，「 馮 」聲，本義為倚靠。《書‧顧命》：「相被冕服，憑玉几。」 「 憑 」可表示依托、依仗。《文選‧陸機〈苦寒行〉》：「猛虎憑林嘯，玄猿臨岸嘆。」李善注：「憑，依也。」 「 憑 」也表示依附。晉干寶《搜神記》卷四：「忽聞有神呼曰：『我天帝使者，欲下憑君，可乎？』」 「 憑 」還表示根據。唐韓愈〈進順宗皇帝實錄表狀〉：「今之所以知古，後之所以知今，不可口傳，必憑諸史。」 「 憑 」也指證書。宋周煇《清波別志》卷上：「先是，貫在北境，約趙良嗣歸國，以副使印給憑。」 「 憑 」亦表示任憑。唐王建〈原上新居〉之十一：「古碣憑人搨，閑詩任客吟。」 「 憑 」還指請求、煩勞。唐杜甫〈公安送李二十九弟晉肅入蜀余下沔鄂〉：「憑將百錢卜，漂泊問君平。」 滿足也用「 憑 」表示。《楚辭‧離騷》：「眾皆競進以貪婪兮，憑不猒乎求索。」王逸注：「憑，滿也。楚人名滿曰憑。」 「 憑 」也可表示煩悶、憤怒。漢張衡〈西京賦〉：「雖斯宇之既坦，心猶憑而未攄。」 「 憑 」還可表示大、盛。《列子‧湯問》：「帝憑怒，侵減龍伯之國使阨，侵小龍伯之民使短。」張湛注：「憑，大也。」
From the " heart" and " feng" sound, the original meaning is to rely on. "Shu‧Gu Ming": "The appearance is served with a jade table." " Ping" can mean relying on and relying on. "Selected Works-Lu Ji's Bitter Cold Travel": "The fierce tiger leans against Lin Xiao, and the mysterious ape sighs at the shore." Li Shan's note: "Ping, Yi Ye." " Ping" also means attachment. Jin Ganbao's "Sou Shen Ji" Volume Four: "Suddenly heard that there is a god calling out: "My emissary of the emperor, if you want to follow the emperor, can you?"" " Ping" also expresses the basis. Tang Hanyu "Records of Emperor Jin Shunzong": "The reason why you know the ancients today, and the reason you know the present later, cannot be passed on orally. It must be based on history." " Reliable" also refers to a certificate. Song Zhouhui's "Farewell to the Qing Dynasty" volume: "First, I went to the northern border, and asked for Zhao Liangsi to return to the country, and printed it to Ping by the deputy." " Ping" also means to let it go. Tang Wangjian's Eleventh of "Original New Residence": "Ancient Jie relies on people to expand, and leisure poems can be chanted by guests." " Ping" also refers to request and trouble. Tang Dufu "Public Security Sent Li's Twenty-Ninth Brother Jin Su to Shu's Remaining Mian'e": "With a hundred dollars of money, I wander and ask Junping." Satisfaction is also expressed by " reliance". "Chu Ci‧ Lisao": "Everyone is eager to be greedy, relying on not to seek." Wang Yi's note: "Ping, full. The name of Chu people is full of Ping." " Ping" can also mean boredom and anger. Han Zhang Heng's "Xijing Fu": "Although Si Yuzhi is frank, his heart still depends on it, but he hasn't pressed it." " Ping" can also mean grand and prosperous. "Liezi Tang Wen": "The emperor uses anger to invade and subdue the emperor of Long Bo's kingdom, and invade the people of Xiao Long Bo to make it short." Zhang Zhan's note: "Ping, Da Ye."

憑字的基本解释

憑
píng
见“凭”。

憑字的汉语字典释义

[①]［píng］
［《廣韻》扶冰切，平蒸，並。］
［《集韻》皮冰切，平蒸，並。］
“凭1”的繁体字。亦作“凭1”。
(1)靠着。
(2)依托；依仗。
(3)指依附；附着。
(4)根据。
(5)指作为根据的事物。
(6)证书。
(7)任凭。
(8)请求；烦劳。
(9)满，满足。
(10)烦闷；愤怒。
(11)大；盛。
(12)无舟过河，徒涉。

憑字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　憑； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页402第16
【廣韻】扶冰切【集韻】【韻會】皮冰切，?音凭。依也，託也。【書·顧命】憑玉几。　又姓。　又叶蒲蒙切，音蓬。【華覈·自責文】越從朽壤，蟬脫朝中。熙光紫闥，靑瑣是憑。　俗作慿，非。

憑字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
憑字的起名意思

暂无。

[①]［píng］
["Guangyun" cut the ice, steamed, and combined. ]
["Ji Yun" skin ice cut, flat steamed, and. ]
"Ping 1" in traditional characters. Also known as "Ping 1".
(1) Lean on.
(2) Relying on; relying on.
(3) Refers to attachment; attachment.
(4) Basis.
(5) Refers to the thing as a basis.
(6) Certificate.
(7) Let alone.
(8) Request; troublesome.
(9) Full and satisfied.
(10) Depression; anger.
(11) Big; Sheng.
(12) Crossing the river without a boat, wade in vain.
